name: Steamed Cod or Sea Bass Salad With Red Peppers, Cilantro and Mint
description: This refreshing combination has Middle Eastern overtones, though in the Middle East the fish would probably be fried or poached. Serve it as a first course or as a light main dish. Pacific sea bass or Pacific cod are the most environmentally friendly types of fish to use here.
keywords: black olives, red bell pepper, sea bass, dairy-free, gluten-free, healthy, nut-free, fall, main course
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds Pacific cod or Pacific sea bass fillets
1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds, lightly toasted and ground
1 large red pepper, cut in 1/4-inch dice

recipeInstructions.text: Steam the fish above 1 inch boiling water for 5 to 7 minutes, until the fish pulls apart into large flakes easily when you poke it with a fork. Remove from the heat and transfer to a colander set in the sink. Allow to cool, then remove any bones and transfer to a large bowl. Toss with half the chopped herbs.
Place the garlic in a mortar and pestle with a generous pinch of salt and mash to a paste. Add the cumin, work in the olive oil with the pestle and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Toss the fish with the dressing, the red pepper and the olives. Taste and adjust seasoning. Add the remaining cilantro and mint shortly before serving and toss together.
